block.p: Medora Ames Plimpton, the daughter of Freddy Medora Espy Plimpton of Bridgehampton, N.Y., and George Plimpton of New York, was married yesterday, to Spencer Knight Harris, a son of Donna and Robert Harris of Alstead, N.H. The Rev. Cece Wick, an interfaith minister, officiated at the couple's farm in Starksboro, Vt.

Ms. Plimpton, 29, will keep her name. Until two weeks ago she was the education program director of the Green Mountain Audubon Society in Huntington, Vt. She is also an emergency medical technician for the Richmond (Vt.) Rescue Squad and for the Sugarbush Resort ski patrol. She graduated from Hampshire College in Amherst, Mass.

Medora Ames Plimpton, the daughter of Freddy Medora Espy Plimpton of Bridgehampton, N.Y., and George Plimpton of New York, was married yesterday, to Spencer Knight Harris, a son of Donna and Robert Harris of Alstead, N.H. The Rev. Cece Wick, an interfaith minister, officiated at the couple's farm in Starksboro, Vt.

Ms. Plimpton, 29, will keep her name. Until two weeks ago she was the education program director of the Green Mountain Audubon Society in Huntington, Vt. She is also an emergency medical technician for the Richmond (Vt.) Rescue Squad and for the Sugarbush Resort ski patrol. She graduated from Hampshire College in Amherst, Mass.

The bride's father is the editor of The Paris Review, a literary journal. He is the author of numerous books, some about his forays into professional sports, and is a frequent speaker and television-documentary host. The bride's mother is a freelance decorator and artist in Bridgehampton. Her paternal grandfather, the late Francis T. P. Plimpton, was a founding partner of Debevoise & Plimpton, the New York law firm, and a deputy United States representative at the United Nations in the Kennedy and Johnson administrations. Her maternal grandfather was Willard R. Espy, the author of books about language.

The bridegroom, 36, owns Vermont Contours, which designs residential sites, in Bristol, Vt. He graduated from the University of Vermont. His parents are retired. His mother owned D. W. Harris Real Estate in Keene, N.H. His father was an installations and repairs manager for New England Telephone.
